commitResults.messageTitle: Update User Guide to include tag and untag commands
Update User Guide to add empty line at end of file
Update skeletal PPP by adding line at end of file
Update User Guide based on PR comments
Update User Guide to change format of tag and untag commands
Update User Guide to remove unused parameters in add and edit commands
Update use cases of Developer Guide v1.1
commitResults.messageBody:
This commit will close #4 by updating use cases to reflect the user
journey map for AIA.

Let's add the following use cases,
* Add a new contact
* Update a contact
* List all contacts in Address Book
* Delete a contact
* Find contact by keyword
* Set previously contacted date
* List all contacts in Address Book within a designated time frame
* Set reminder
* View reminders of a contact
* View reminders on a date
* Delete a reminder
* Show all tags
* Show all contacts that are tagged to a tag
* Add a tag to a contact
* Delete a tag from a contact

commitResults.messageTitle: Update glossary of Developer Guide v1.1
commitResults.messageBody:
This commit closes #6 by updating glossary to explain commonly used
terms in the Developer Guide.

Let's add the following terms,
* Address Book
* Application
* MSS

commitResults.messageTitle: Add back Mainsteam OS to the glossary
Update use cases according to review comments
Add function to filter contacts by a tag
commitResults.messageBody:
The existing tagging system is under-developed, as users cannot do
anything else, besides adding and removing a set of tags.

To provide users a better user experience, users will be able to filter
contacts by a tag, just like Instagram tag filtering system, with the
command `#TAG`. Example: #friends will filter those contacts that are
tagged with `friends`.

Let's,
* Add an alternate path in parseCommand to return HashtagCommand
* Add HashtagCommand for the execution of the filtering by Tag
* Add HashtagCommandParser to parse user input to a Tag object
* Add case-insensitive hasTagIgnoreCase(Tag) to check if Person has Tag
* Add PersonContainsTagPredicate to test if a Person is tagged to a Tag
* Add case-insensitive equality check isSameTagIgnoreCase(Tag) in Tag

This commit mainly uses the existing abstraction only.

Resolves #34 less test cases (see the next commit).

commitResults.messageTitle: Add test cases to fully resolve #34
commitResults.messageBody:
Test cases are added to ensure that the application has no regression
after the previous commit that resolve #34.

Let's,
* Add test method parseCommand_hashtag to AddressBookParserTest
* Add HashtagCommandParserTest
  * Add parse_emptyArg_throwsParseException()
  * Add parse_notAlphanumeric_throwsParseException()
  * Add parse_validArgs_returnsHashtagCommand()
* Add HashtagCommandTest
  * Add isHashTag_hashTag_returnsTrue()
  * Add isHashTag_notHashTag_returnFalse()
  * Add execute_noMatchingTag_noPersonFound()
  * Add execute_matchingTag_multiplePersonsFound()
  * Add equals()
* Add PersonContainsTagPredicateTest
  * Add constructor_null_throwsNullPointerException()
  * Add test_personContainsTag_returnsTrue()
  * Add test_personDoesNotContainsTag_returnsFalse()
  * Add equals()
* Update PersonTest
  * Add hasTagIgnoreCase_hasTagIgnoreCase_returnsTrue()
  * Add hasTagIgnoreCase_noTagOrNull_returnsFalse()
* Update TagTest
  * Add isSameTagIgnoreCase_notSameTagOrNull_returnsFalse()
  * Add isSameTagIgnoreCase_sameTag_returnsTrue()

commitResults.messageTitle: Add public access modifier to some test methods
Update Tag's equals() to be case-insensitive
commitResults.messageBody:
It is better for tags to be case-insensitive, so that duplicates but
different capitalisation cannot be considered as different.

Let's,
* Update Tag's equals()
* Remove isSameTagIgnoreCase(Tag) in Tag, replaced by equals()
* Update hasTagIgnoreCase(Tag) in Person to hasTag(Tag), uses equals()
* Update affected test cases

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Tag's hashCode() to fix Set<Tag>.contains
Update user profile,stories and value proposition for v1.1
commitResults.messageBody:
The target user profile, user stories and value proposition
reflect the requirements of AB3.

This is not representative of the requirements for AIA.

Let's update the target user profile, user stories and
value proposition in linewith designated requirements
of AIA to close AY2122S2-CS2103T-T17-3#3 as part of
the v1.1 increment.

The non-functional requirements are designated for that of AB3.

This is not representative of the requirements for AIA.

Let's update the non-functional requirements to reflect the
requirements necessary for AIA to close AY2122S2-CS2103T-T17-3#5
as part of the v1.1 increment for developer guide.

commitResults.messageTitle: Change name of markdown to match requirement
Remove specifications for OS in NFR

commitResults.messageBody:
The application does not have a date class to handle time based
events easily.

Let's make a custom date class for future increments like
adding a birthdate, adding a reminder and adding last
contacted date.

The application does not have a date class to handle time based
events easily.

Let's make a custom date class to close AY2122S2-CS2103T-T17-3#29
so future increments like adding a birthdate, adding a
reminder and adding previous contacted date can manipulate
time based events.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update Date class to PR suggestions

commitResults.messageBody:
Help feature directs users to the AB3 user guide. This is
misleading as AIA is a different application from AB3.

Let's do a quick fix by changing the link to the AIA user guide.

This will close AY2122S2-CS2103T-T17-3#31 by providing relevant
user support.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add constant for twenty years limit

commitResults.messageBody:
The DocumentedDate class has a check that throws an
IllegalValueException.

As future increments would fix input and ensure LocalDate
parameters passed to the DocumentDate class would be valid,
such a check is unnecessary.

Let's remove this check for better code readability.

This commit will close
https://github.com/AY2122S2-CS2103T-T17-3/tp/issues/11 by updating AIA's
README and AboutUs.

This commit will close
https://github.com/AY2122S2-CS2103T-T17-3/tp/issues/25 by updating PPP
for team member Nadine.
